176.article_body: Actor Sumeet Vyas said he spent time with friends with "very heavy Haryanavi accent" for preparation of role in television series 'Jugaadistan'. "I was very scared of the accent...They wanted me to speak in way that is understandable by most people...I had few friends who are from that region...I was hanging out with them...don't think they were aware," he said.

177.title: Who is leading where in Assembly elections 2022 as per early trends?
177.article_body: As per latest trends, BJP is leading in Uttar Pradesh Assembly polls with 115 seats. AAP is leading in 24 seats in 117-member Punjab Assembly. In Uttarakhand, BJP is leading in 25 seats, while Congress is leading in 20 seats. In Goa, BJP is leading in 8 seats, while in Manipur, BJP is leading in 4 seats.

178.title: Never considered acting as a career; was more inclined towards business: Navya
178.article_body: Speaking to Barkha Dutt in an interview, actor Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda said she never considered acting as a career. "I was always...inclined towards business. My grandmother and aunt were both working women," she added. "I am also the fourth generation of the Nandas to take over that. I really wanted to carry that legacy forward," Navya said.

179.title: 2 brothers force wives to drink 'black water' to have sons in Pune
179.article_body: Two twin brothers have been booked for alleged domestic violence and using black magic against their twin wives in Pune. According to complaint, the wives alleged that their husbands and in-laws did things like making them drink blackened water so they'd produce a son. One wife was pregnant when superstitious activity was done, DCP (Zone 3) Pornima Gaikwad said.

180.title: 70-yr-old patient's gold bangle stolen at Chandigarh's PGIMER
180.article_body: A 70-year-old patient's gold bangle was stolen while she was waiting for doctor's consultation outside the urology department of PGIMER's New OPD block on Tuesday. The accused used a cutter to remove the bangle from the patient's wrist, police said. "We will check the CCTV footage and try to find the culprit," Kumar Gaurav Dhawan, deputy director (administration), PGIMER said.

181.title: 27-yr-old man arrested for cheating cinema aspirants in Hyderabad
181.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested a 27-year-old man for allegedly cheating people on the pretext of providing them jobs in the film industry. According to police, a victim filed a complaint after he was duped of ₹90,000. The accused had introduced himself as a manager and assistant director at Ramoji Film City and hosted an app named 'Cine Drive-In', police added.

182.title: 68-yr-old Mumbai woman cheated of ₹11 lakh by Nigerian man on pretext of marriage
182.article_body: A 28-year-old Nigerian national has been arrested for cheating a 68-year-old widow from Mumbai of ₹11 lakh by posing as a UK-based businessman and promising to marry her and take her abroad with him. The accused met the victim on Facebook. As per reports, he allegedly used another person's photograph as his display picture and went by a fake name.

183.title: Alia was a girl, and now, she's a woman: Pooja Bhatt on 'Gangubai...'
183.article_body: Pooja Bhatt has said she watched the first-day first-show of 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' and heard people whistling in the theatre. "Usually, you don't expect multiplex audiences to whistle...but while watching Gangubai, I heard whistles, screams, yelling," she added. Pooja also praised Alia Bhatt's performance in the film, saying, "She was a girl, and now, she's a woman and she's dazzling."

184.title: Have ensured women feel confident to file complaints: Delhi (Central) DCP
184.article_body: DCP (Central) Shweta Chauhan, Central Delhi's first woman DCP in 45 years, in an interview said that there is a need to provide a safe and secure environment to women, for them to realise their full potential. The DCP further said that she has ensured that women feel confident to walk into police stations to lodge complaints.

185.title: Benzema scores hat-trick as Real Madrid knock PSG out of Champions League
185.article_body: Karim Benzema produced a hat-trick as Real Madrid came from being 0-2 down on aggregate to knock PSG out of the Champions League and enter the quarterfinals. Kylian Mbappe's first-half strike put PSG ahead but Benzema's goals in the second half helped Madrid claim 3-1 victory in the second leg on Wednesday night. PSG had won the first-leg 1-0.

186.title: Teacher gets 20-year jail for raping 6-year-old student in Bengaluru
186.article_body: A 46-year-old teacher, Jaishankar, has been sentenced to 20 years of imprisonment and ₹4 lakh fine for raping a six-year-old student in a private school in Bengaluru in 2014. The incident came to light after the minor girl complained of stomachache and was taken to a doctor, after which it was revealed that she was raped in school toilet twice.

187.title: Election Commission is ready for 'One Nation, One Election': CEC Sushil Chandra
187.article_body: 'One Nation One Election' is a good suggestion but it will need a change in the Constitution and it is to be decided in the Parliament, said Chief Election Commissioner Sushil Chandra.  The Election Commission is fully prepared and is capable of conducting simultaneous elections, he added. Chandra said, "According to the Constitution, all the elections should be held simultaneously."

188.title: CCTV image shows Warne walking at Thailand villa moments before his death
188.article_body: A CCTV image has surfaced online showing Australian cricket legend Shane Warne walking at a Thailand villa moments before his death. Warne was walking through the lobby of the villa on the island of Koh Samui after carrying new shirts from his local tailor. Warne passed away due to heart attack aged 52.

189.title: 22-yr-old Ukrainian man charged in ransomware spree extradited to US
189.article_body: A 22-year-old Ukrainian man, Yaroslav Vasinskyi, charged last year with conducting severe ransomware attacks against US targets, has been extradited to the US. Vasinskyi was allegedly behind the July attack against software provider Kaseya. Vasinskyi accessed internal computer networks of several victim companies and deployed Sodinokibi/REvil ransomware to encrypt the data on their computers.

190.title: 1,000 personnel, drones in place as Noida gears up for Assembly poll results
190.article_body: Over 1,000 police personnel, drone cameras and three companies of PAC (Provincial Armed Constabulary) will keep a strict vigil across Gautam Budh Nagar district as the counting of votes for the assembly elections will take place today. The counting of votes for all the three constituencies in GB Nagar will take place at the flower market in Sector 88, Noida.

191.title: Russia may use chemical, biological weapons in Ukraine: US
191.article_body: The US rejected Russian claims that Washington was operating biowarfare labs in Ukraine. "Now that Russia has made these false claims, and China has seemingly endorsed this propaganda, we should all be on...lookout for Russia to possibly use chemical or biological weapons in Ukraine, or to create a false flag operation using them," White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said.

192.title: Duplicate cigarette unit busted in Hyd; items worth ₹2 cr seized
192.article_body: A police task force has busted a duplicate cigarette manufacturing unit in Hyderabad's Sultan Bazaar and seized items worth a total of ₹2 crore from the place. The seizure reportedly includes 500 tobacco bags, each weighing about 25 kg, 170 cigarette filter cartons, 400 cigarette paper rolls of various brands and six silver paper rolls. One person has been arrested.

193.title: Ukraine releases intercepted calls of Russian soldiers talking to their close ones
193.article_body: On its official Twitter account, Ukraine released intercepted calls of Russian soldiers talking to their close ones. "These are real intercepted calls...Looting and war crimes included. Please, share! The world must know the truth of what they're doing to our homes and people," Ukraine tweeted. A Russian soldier can be heard saying, "I drank a f***ing cognac worth 7k."

194.title: 25-yr-old man on way to meet girlfriend dies as truck hits him in Mumbai
194.article_body: A 25-year-old man was killed after a dumper truck hit his motorcycle and ran over him near Mumbai's Kandivali East on Tuesday. The man reportedly lost control after the truck hit his motorcycle from behind. He fell and was crushed under the truck. Police said that the man was on his way to meet his girlfriend in Dahisar.

195.title: It's still not too late to get into crypto: Mudrex
195.article_body: Crypto startup Mudrex stated that while crypto 'maxis' have been bullish on holding a single coin, Mudrex has emerged with the concept of investing in ideas instead of single coins. Mudrex Coin Sets is the flagship product, letting users invest in expert-created crypto baskets, the company said, adding that it is trusted by over 1,00,000 investors across 100+ countries already.

196.title: Counting of votes for Assembly elections in UP, Punjab, U'khand, Goa & Manipur begins
196.article_body: Counting of votes for Uttar Pradesh, Punjab, Uttarakhand, Goa and Manipur state Assemblies has begun. Voting took place in Uttar Pradesh in seven phases and in Manipur in two phases, while Punjab, Uttarakhand and Goa saw one phase of voting each. Counting of post ballot votes has started, the counting of votes polled in EVMs will begin at 8.30 am.

197.title: B'luru doctors successfully transplant woman's kidney on 10-yr-old son
197.article_body: Doctors at Bengaluru's Aster CMI Hospital successfully transplanted a mother's kidney on her 10-year-old son in a six-hour-long surgery. The 41-year-old woman had donated one of her kidneys to her son as he was diagnosed with end-stage renal disease. The boy reportedly started showing uremic symptoms like fatigue, muscle cramps and vomiting with high blood pressure when he was nine-year-old.

198.title: India to bowl first against New Zealand in 2022 Women's World Cup, playing XI announced
198.article_body: India captain Mithali Raj won the toss and elected to bowl first against New Zealand in their second 2022 Women's World Cup match at Seddon Park in Hamilton. India have made one change to their playing XI, with Yastika Bhatia replacing Shafali Verma. India have faced New Zealand 53 times in women's ODI cricket, winning 20 times.

199.title: Louis Vuitton hosts its Paris fashion show at Musée d'Orsay museum
199.article_body: High-end luxury fashion label Louis Vuitton took over Musée d'Orsay museum in France to host its Paris fashion show on Monday. The brand's collection showcased models in outsized jackets and shirts layered over colourful dresses as they walked among marble and bronze sculptures. 'Squid Game' actress Hoyeon Jung wore a brown jacket, wide-leg striped pants and a yellow floral tie.

200.title: Told parents to stop reading garbage: Malaika on online trolling
200.article_body: Actress Malaika Arora while talking about online trolling in a recent interview revealed that her parents get affected by it. "My parents would keep saying, 'beta someone said this or that'. And finally, I sat them down and said, 'Enough! Stop reading...this garbage'," she said. The 48-year-old added that after their talk, the trolling topic never came up again.

201.title: 'Kahaani' helped redefine concept of Indian film heroine: Vidya Balan
201.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan has said that her 2012 movie, 'Kahaani', played a "huge role" in redefining "the concept of Indian film heroine". The 43-year-old further called the movie one of her "most special films" as it completed 10 years of its release on Wednesday. "I still remember every day on...shoot. It was like our lives depended on it," she added.

202.title: I lost the dream I had been working on for 18 years: Russia's Mazepin on F1 exit
202.article_body: Former Haas driver Nikita Mazepin on Wednesday said he lost the dream he worked towards for 18 years when he found out he was released by American F1 team Haas following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Haas cut ties with Russian driver Mazepin and title sponsor Uralkali, owned by Mazepin's father Dmitry, who is an associate of Russian President Vladimir Putin.

203.title: Reliance stepping in to supply diesel to Europe amid Russia-Ukraine crisis: Report
203.article_body: Mukesh Ambani-led Reliance Industries Ltd's (RIL) Jamnagar facility is gearing up to supply diesel to Europe amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine, a report said. According to Bloomberg, RIL has deferred maintenance work at Jamnagar plant, and is increasing crude processing in a bid to gain from surge in global demand. It's already sending shipments of fuel to Europe, it said.

204.title: Over 2,500 Ukrainian refugees have arrived in Ireland: Minister
204.article_body: Over 2,500 people fleeing the Russian invasion of Ukraine have arrived in Ireland, with children comprising a third of that number, Irish Justice Minister Helen McEntee said on Wednesday. The Irish government has said Ukrainian refugees will receive medical cards, as well as a Personal Public Service (PPS) number, which will enable them to access certain social welfare benefits.

205.title: Governing bodies of tennis, 4 Grand Slams donate $700,000 to Ukraine
205.article_body: The ATP, WTA and the International Tennis Federation (ITF) along with all four Grand Slams - the Australian Open, Wimbledon, the US Open and the French Open on Wednesday announced a joint donation of $700,000 to Ukraine. All seven bodies have donated $100,000 each to support GlobalGiving's Ukraine Crisis Relief Fund, which will aid humanitarian relief efforts.

206.title: 25-yr-old man kidnapped for ₹15 lakh ransom found dead in MP forest
206.article_body: A 25-year-old man suffering from paralysis was found dead in a forest in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur after being allegedly abducted for ₹15 lakh ransom. Identified as Rahul Singh, the victim was reportedly found dead in a ditch in Dharampur forest area on Tuesday and his body was decomposed. Police were alerted after the corpse was found by a cattle grazer.

207.title: 3 pubs in Indore sealed for serving liquor to minors
207.article_body: The local administration sealed three pubs in Indore on Wednesday for serving liquor to minors and committing other irregularities, an official said. "These pubs were found serving liquor to children and also operating beyond the administration-fixed deadline of 11.30 pm," Indore Sub-Divisional Magistrate (SDM) Akshay Singh Markam said. The pubs stocked liquor beyond permissible limits, he said.

208.title: Russian designer removed from Paris Fashion Week amid Ukraine crisis
208.article_body: France's fashion body, Fédération de la Haute Couture et de la Mode, announced that it has removed Russian designer Valentin Yudashkin from this year's Paris Fashion Week calendar amid the Ukraine crisis. President of the fashion body, Ralph Toledano, said, "If he had doubt about the war in Ukraine, it'd have been hard to remove him...That was not the case."

209.title: I'm working today not because of money but for passion: Akshay Kumar
209.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar in a recent media interaction said that he is working in films today "not because of money" anymore, but "for passion". During the promotion of his next release 'Bachchhan Paandey' on Wednesday, the 54-year-old said, "I choose to go to work in...morning and take...break on Sundays." He added, "The day I feel disinterested...I will stop working."

210.title: There will be infighting in Yadav family after UP polls: Minister
210.article_body: Union Minister Kaushal Kishore on Wednesday said that Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav is "perplexed and frustrated", adding that infighting within the family will begin after the declaration of State Assembly election results on Thursday. Referring to Yadav's statements on the electronic voting machines (EVMs), Kishore said that the SP chief doesn't have faith in the Election Commission.

211.title: Amit Shah has landed in Goa to buy other party members: Congress
211.article_body: Congress leader Ivan D'Souza on Wednesday levelled horse-trading allegations on BJP ahead of counting of votes for Goa polls. "Amit Shah is already...in Goa and other leaders also landed in Goa...Just to buy the other party members," he added. He said in 2017, Congress was the single-largest party with 17 members and BJP indulged in horse-trading.

212.title: Nadal has to be the favourite going into Indian Wells: Tommy Haas
212.article_body: Indian Wells tournament director Tommy Haas said 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal is the favourite to win the BNP Paribas Open. "He is, in my opinion, the guy to beat here, there is no doubt about it," Haas said. The current world number four is on a 15-match unbeaten run in 2022 that includes the Australian Open in January.

213.title: Children dying of cancer made to stand in 'Z' shape in snow to support Russia
213.article_body: Terminally ill children at a hospice in Russia were told to stand in the shape of a 'Z' to show support for the invasion of Ukraine. Images posted by Vladimir Vavilov, the chairman of a cancer charity that runs the hospice, show around 60 people gathered in the snow. The letter 'Z' was seen on Russian military equipment in Ukraine.

214.title: Really happy that 'mankad' dismissal has been changed to 'run out': Sachin
214.article_body: Talking about the new cricket rules being introduced by MCC, Sachin Tendulkar said that he is supportive of the 'mankaded' dismissal being changed to 'run-out' category. "I was always uncomfortable with that particular dismissal being called mankaded. I am really happy that it has been changed to run out. It always should have been run out," Sachin added.

215.title: New COVID-19 cases, deaths continue to drop globally: WHO
215.article_body: The World Health Organization on Tuesday said in its weekly report that new COVID-19 cases and deaths continue to drop globally. Compared to the previous week, new cases declined by 5% and deaths declined by 8%. Over 10 million new cases and over 52,000 deaths were reported last week. Only the Western Pacific region reported a 46% increase in cases.

216.title: We know it's going to be a difficult game: Pochettino on Real Madrid
216.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) on Wednesday will face Real Madrid in their UEFA Champions League Round of 16 second-leg tie, which PSG manager Mauricio Pochettino says will be "a difficult game". PSG won the first-leg against Real Madrid 1-0. "The best way to approach the game is to play and attack in the opposition's half," Pochettino said.

217.title: 4 die, 2 seriously ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar
217.article_body: At least four people have died and two taken seriously ill after consuming spurious liquor in Bihar's West Champaran and Siwan districts, officials said on Wednesday. According to officials, while one death was reported from Khaptola village under the Nautan police station of West Champaran, three others died in Dhebar village under the Daraundha police station limits of Siwan.

218.title: 16-yr-old girl attempts suicide after father rapes her in UP
218.article_body: A 16-year-old girl attempted suicide after she was allegedly raped by her father in a village under the Khudaganj police station area in Uttar Pradesh, police said on Wednesday. The incident took place on March 5, when the girl's mother had gone out to meet relatives, said Superintendent of Police (Rural) Sanjeev Bajpai. The accused has been arrested.

219.title: UN World Food Programme aims to help over 3 mn Ukrainians: Director
219.article_body: United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) aims to help over 3 million Ukrainians with food donations, Director General David Beasley said on Wednesday. Beasley made the remark in Poland's Warsaw at a news conference on efforts to support refugees from Ukraine. Over 2 million people have fled Ukraine since the Russian invasion with Poland hosting about 1.2 million of them.

220.title: Russian soldiers let down by appalling leaders: UK Defence Secy
220.article_body: UK's Defence Secretary Ben Wallace on Tuesday said Russian soldiers have suffered the heaviest losses since Russia invaded its neighbour Ukraine and have been "let down by appalling leaders". Ukraine has claimed that over 11,000 Russian soldiers, including four commanders, have already been killed. "We can see that the Russians are having real logistical problems," Wallace said.

221.title: Gathering of people outside counting centres banned in Punjab tomorrow
221.article_body: In view of the counting of votes on Thursday, no gathering of people will be allowed outside counting centres in Punjab. Punjab Chief Electoral Officer S Karuna Raju said victory processions are prohibited as well. Only two people can accompany the winning candidate or his official representative to the counting centre to collect the certificate.

222.title: Part of bridge collapses in Odisha; 2 killed & many feared trapped
222.article_body: Two persons were killed and one was injured after a portion of a bridge collapsed at Chhatra Bazar in Odisha's Cuttack on Wednesday evening. Many people are feared trapped on the spot. An investigation will be done and action will be taken against those found responsible for the incident, District Magistrate Bhabani Shankar Chayani said.

223.title: Prabhas thanks Big B, others for lending voice to 'Radhe Shyam'
223.article_body: Actor Prabhas took to social media to share a note for all those who lent their voices for his upcoming movie 'Radhe Shyam'. He posted the note on Instagram, wherein he thanked filmmaker SS Rajamouli and actors Amitabh Bachchan, Prithviraj Sukumaran and Shiva Rajkumar. It further read, "Expressing my gratitude for making this film even more special for us."

224.title: Tiger found dead in MP's tiger reserve, territorial fight suspected
224.article_body: An adult tiger was found dead in the Pench Tiger Reserve (PTR) in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district. The carcass of the feline, around 12 years old, was said to have been found with multiple injury marks and it was suspected that the animal died in a territorial fight. It was disposed of as per the National Tiger Conservation Authority guidelines.

225.title: PM thanks Hungary's PM for facilitating 6,000 Indians' evacuation
225.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday spoke with his Hungarian counterpart His Excellency Viktor Orban and thanked him for facilitating the evacuation of over 6,000 Indians through the Ukraine-Hungary border. "PM Orban...said that Indian medical students could choose to continue their studies in Hungary if they wished," PMO said. The duo also discussed the situation in Ukraine.

226.title: Kids buried under wreckage as Russian strike hits hospital, Ukraine Prez shares video
226.article_body: Ukrainian officials said a Russian strike has hit a children's hospital and maternity facility in the besieged southeastern port city of Mariupol. A statement on the city council's social media account on Wednesday said the hospital suffered "colossal" damage. Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy tweeted that there were "people, children under the wreckage" while sharing a video.

227.title: 18 injured, 4 died during Manipur polls amid high turnout: Report
227.article_body: A total of 18 people have been injured and four have died during the Manipur elections amid a high turnout of voters, according to reports. The EVMs and polling teams were airlifted after three helicopters, including one ALH of Global Vectra and one MI17 of IAF were deployed. The injured people and security forces were reportedly given cashless treatment.

228.title: McDonald's says closing stores in Russia will cost it $50 mn per month
228.article_body: McDonald's on Wednesday said closing stores in Russia in response to the Russia-Ukraine war will cost the fast food chain $50 million a month. McDonald's owns 84% of its Russian locations itself and said it'll continue to pay its 62,000 staff and restaurant employees in Russia. "This is a really challenging and complex situation for...us," said McDonald's CFO Kevin Ozan.

229.title: 6 killed, 3 injured in head-on collision between truck & car in UP
229.article_body: Six men were killed and three were left with critical injuries in a head-on collision between a mini-truck and a car on the Etawah-Mainpuri road in Uttar Pradesh, police said. The crash took place on Wednesday when a group of people from Jaswantnagar area were on their way to attend a function. The injured were admitted to the hospital.

230.title: Germany certainly not sending warplanes to Ukraine: Chancellor Scholz
230.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz has said that the country certainly won't send warplanes to Ukraine amid Russian invasion. Scholz's comments came after US rejected Poland's offer to transfer its Russian-made MiG-29 jets to a US base in Germany. "We've provided all kinds of defence materials [to Ukraine] and...sent weapons...but...we have to consider very carefully what we do [next]," Scholz said.

231.title: 3 FIRs filed after confrontation in Mangaluru college over hijab
231.article_body: Three FIRs have been registered in Mangaluru following a confrontation between two student groups over wearing hijab during examination at a college. This comes as Karnataka High Court is yet to announce its verdict over ban on hijab in educational institutions. Police said "one case is registered on a female student's complaint against some other students and 15 ABVP members."

232.title: 22-yr-old cricketer Rahul Chahar marries longtime girlfriend Ishani in Goa, shares pics
232.article_body: Cricketer Rahul Chahar tied the knot with his longtime girlfriend Ishani in Goa on Wednesday. He took to Instagram to share pictures, writing, "Our Happily ever after." Rahul and Ishani had got engaged in December 2019. The 22-year-old leg-spinner, who was part of India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, was bought by Punjab Kings in IPL mega auction last month.

233.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹1,984 crore in Karvy Stock Broking scam
233.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday said it has attached immovable and movable properties worth ₹1,984 crore belonging to Karvy Stock Broking, its Chairman Comandur Parthasarathy and others in a money laundering case. Attached properties include landed properties worth ₹213.6 crore, tangible/intangible assets worth ₹1,280 crore and Parthasarathy's shareholding worth ₹438.7 crore, ED said.

234.title: 4 robbers distract Guj trader in car, escape with bag containing ₹15 lakh
234.article_body: Four robbers stole a bag containing ₹15 lakhs from the car of a trader in Gujarat's Morbi town on Tuesday. However, two of the accused were caught in Rajkot, while the two others managed to escape. The accused, with the help of a boy, were able to distract the trader and escaped with the bag full of cash.

235.title: Congo militiamen kill 18 civilians in church compound: Report
235.article_body: Militiamen have killed 18 civilians in a church compound in Democratic Republic of Congo on Tuesday, a witness and a local human rights groups said. The civilians were sleeping in the church outbuildings when the attack took place in Banyali Kilo district in the Ituri province, according to a report. They had reportedly fled there after escaping from previous attacks.

236.title: Women hold topless protest against Russia in front of Eiffel Tower; video surfaces
236.article_body: Women part of a feminist group held a topless protest in front of the Eiffel Tower in Paris to protest against Russian invasion of Ukraine. The video of the protest shows their chests painted with colours of the Ukrainian flag and slogans like 'Stop Putin's War', 'Feminists against War' and 'Slava Ukraini' written on them.

237.title: Highly dangerous: Karti on Indian student fighting for Ukraine
237.article_body: On reports that a 21-year-old student from Tamil Nadu will fight for Ukraine against Russia, Congress MP Karti Chidambaram said that this is highly dangerous. "Imagine if a Muslim youth from Coimbatore goes to Syria and fights against Assad. Wouldn't he be called a Jihadi?" he asked. "I don't agree with citizens of other nations joining the war," he added.

238.title: Sarpanch shot dead near Srinagar in J&K, 2nd incident in 1 week
238.article_body: A village sarpanch was shot dead by suspected terrorists on the outskirts of Srinagar in Jammu and Kashmir on Wednesday. The victim has been identified as Sameer Ahmad Bhat, the sarpanch of the Khanmoh area. This is the second such incident in a week as a panchayat member in Kulgam district was shot dead by terrorists last Wednesday.

239.title: Kidnapped Bihar businessman rescued, 7 members of gang arrested
239.article_body: The Rohtas Police on Tuesday rescued a businessman from a locked house at Kudra in Bihar's Kaimur district, who was kidnapped on March 5 by an interstate gang, officials said. The kidnappers had demanded a ₹1.5 crore ransom, but the police rescued him and arrested seven members of the gang and recovered an SUV, pistol used in the crime.

240.title: Have ensured peaceful voting, will ensure peaceful counting: UP ADG
240.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes for the ongoing Assembly elections, Uttar Pradesh Additional Director General of Police (law and order) Prashant Kumar said, "We have ensured peaceful voting, we will ensure peaceful counting also". He also said that 70,000 civil police workers, 245 companies of paramilitary forces and 69 company PSE commanders have been deployed for March 10.

241.title: Man who got world's 1st pig heart transplant dies after 2 months in US
241.article_body: The first person to receive a heart transplant from a pig has died two months after the surgery, the US hospital that performed the surgery announced on Wednesday. While doctors didn't give an exact cause of death, they said 57-year-old David Bennett's condition had begun deteriorating several days earlier. He got a transplant from a genetically modified pig.

242.title: Cong doesn't trust them: Goa CM after party moves candidates to resort
242.article_body: Goa CM Pramod Sawant has said that Congress doesn't trust its candidates after the party reportedly moved its candidates to a resort ahead of Assembly election results. "[Congress is] keeping [candidates] in isolation...without knowing who's winning," he added. Reacting to the possibility of hung Assembly, Sawant said independent candidates will back BJP if it falls short of a majority.

243.title: Ukraine accuses Russia of holding 4,00,000 'hostage' in Mariupol
243.article_body: Ukrainian Foreign Minister Dmytro Kuleba on Wednesday accused Russia of holding 4,00,000 people 'hostage' in Mariupol and blocking humanitarian aid and evacuation. He took to Twitter and said that almost 3,000 newborn babies lack medicine and food in the city. "I urge the world to act! Force Russia to stop its barbaric war on civilians and babies!" the minister added.

244.title: Redmi launches Note 11 Pro series & Redmi Watch 2 Lite in India today
244.article_body: All-new Redmi Note 11 Pro+ 5G and Redmi Note 11 Pro were launched today. The latest Redmi Note devices that sport 67W Turbo charging promise a full day's charge in just 15 minutes. Redmi also launched Redmi Watch 2 Lite alongside the two smartphones in what was Xiaomi's first on-ground tech launch event of 2022.

245.title: Woman with 2 uteruses gives birth to 2 babies in a year in US, pic surfaces
245.article_body: A woman from Georgia, US gave birth to two babies in one year, as they each grew in her two different uteruses. Caroline Wortman, 30, discovered she was nearly ten weeks pregnant with her second child, just six months after her daughter's birth. She suffers from a rare condition called uterine didelphys, meaning she was born with two reproductive systems.

246.title: World no. 2 Djokovic added to Indian Wells draw despite vaccine status
246.article_body: World number two Novak Djokovic has been added to the Indian Wells draw despite doubts whether he can play in the US event due to his COVID-19 vaccination status. Current US rules require foreign adult citizens to be fully vaccinated to enter the country. Djokovic, who was deported from Australia due to his vaccine status, recently revealed he remains unvaccinated.

247.title: FIFA suspend Ukraine’s WC playoff against Scotland amid war with Russia
247.article_body: FIFA on Tuesday said it suspended Ukraine's World Cup qualifying playoff match against Scotland following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The match was scheduled to be played on March 24. FIFA added Poland has received a bye through their playoff match against Russia that was scheduled to be played the same day. Ukraine's match with Scotland will be organised in June.

248.title: We're going to get clear majority in Goa polls: Cong's Chidambaram
248.article_body: Senior Congress leader P Chidambaram expressed confidence in the party's victory in the Goa Assembly elections and stated that Congress is going to get a "clear majority". Chidambaram's comment comes after Goa Congress chief Girish Chodankar claimed that talks are underway with Aam Aadmi Party to obtain support for government formation. Exit polls have predicted a hung Assembly in Goa.

249.title: Ukraine warns of risk of radiation leak after power cut at Chernobyl nuclear plant
249.article_body: Ukrainian nuclear company Energoatom has warned of radiation leak from the occupied Chernobyl nuclear power plant because it cannot cool spent nuclear fuel due to power cut. "The radioactive cloud could be carried by wind to other regions of Ukraine, Belarus, Russia, and Europe," it added. Ukraine has appealed to Russia for a temporary ceasefire to repair the power line.

250.title: Puducherry minister dresses as Goddess, says, 'Knew there'll be -ve feedback'
250.article_body: A video of Puducherry minister S Chandira Priyanga dressed as Goddess was released on Women's Day. After the clip got criticism from few, she said she knew there'll be negative feedback but doesn't care about it. "It's not like putting just another get-up...I underwent fasting and stopped eating non-vegetarian food as I feel this is a sacred thing," she said.

251.title: Upper age limit for appearing in NEET-UG examination removed
251.article_body: Upper age limit for appearing in the undergraduate medical entrance exam, NEET-UG, has been removed for all candidates, the National Medical Commission has said. Earlier, the age limit was 25 years for General category candidates and 30 years for Reserved category candidates. The decision was taken in the fourth NMC meeting held in October last year, the commission's secretary said.

252.title: Sreesanth retires from all forms of Indian domestic cricket
252.article_body: Cricketer Sreesanth announced his retirement from all forms of Indian domestic cricket aged 39. In a video posted on Twitter, Sreesanth said he's looking forward to be a part of a coaching setup and also expressed his interest in playing leagues across the globe once BCCI allows. Sreesanth's seven-year ban over IPL 2013 spot-fixing scandal had ended in September 2020.

253.title: 20,000 foreigners joined Ukraine forces to fight against Russia: Report
253.article_body: Around 20,000 foreigners have joined Ukrainian forces to fight against Russia amid the ongoing war, The Kyiv Independent reported. "Foreign volunteers will be able to obtain Ukrainian citizenship if they want to," it quoted Ukraine's First Deputy Interior Minister Yevhen Yenin as saying. There have been reports of citizens of various nations, including India, volunteering to fight for Ukraine.

254.title: BJP wins 759, Congress 76 of 977 wards in Assam Municipal Board election
254.article_body: The BJP won 759 of the total 977 municipal wards in the Assam Municipal Board election on Wednesday, while the Congress managed to secure a win in 76 wards, the state Election Commission said. Polling for one ward will be done later as a candidate died in the Patacharkuchi municipal board. As many as 59 wards were uncontested.

255.title: Ashneer Grover, wife Madhuri pay ₹8.2 crore advance tax: Report
255.article_body: Former BharatPe Managing Director Ashneer Grover has paid ₹7.1 crore advance tax for the assessment year 2022-23, as per a PTI report. Grover's wife Madhuri Jain has paid ₹1.1 crore advance tax, the report said. "This makes him one of the highest taxpayers among startup founders for two years in a row," PTI added while quoting a source.

256.title: Varanasi officer removed after controversy over EVMs' transportation
256.article_body: Varanasi DM Kaushal Raj Sharma has removed ADM NK Singh over charges of dereliction of duty while transporting EVMs to be used for training ahead of counting of votes in UP. The order said the EVMs were supposed to be transported on Wednesday after informing political parties. Since they weren't informed, confusion followed and hence, Singh has been removed.

257.title: Ukraine bans exports of food staples to prevent 'humanitarian crisis'
257.article_body: Ukraine's government has banned the export of wheat and other food staples to prevent a "humanitarian crisis" in the country amid the Russian invasion, a report stated. It has also prohibited the export of buckwheat, meat and other "byproducts" from cattle. Ukraine's minister Roman Leshchenko said the export ban is needed to "meet the population's need in critical food products".

258.title: Sweden prepares tents, warehouses as refugees from Ukraine arrive
258.article_body: Sweden is preparing tents, sports halls and warehouses to accommodate refugees from Ukraine, Swedish Immigration Minister Anders Ygeman said on Wednesday. Swedish Migration Board is reportedly making arrangements to house approximately 30,000 Ukrainian refugees over the coming months, although the number of arrivals could be higher. Around 2,000 refugees arrived in Sweden on Tuesday, Ygeman added.

259.title: Russia warns as Poland offers to send MIG-29 jets to Ukraine, calls it 'dangerous'
259.article_body: Russia has issued a warning after Poland offered to deliver all of its MIG-29 fighter jets to Ukraine after flying them to a US airbase. "This is a highly undesirable and a potentially dangerous scenario," Kremlin spokesman Dmitry Peskov said. The MIG-29 is a fighter jet that was developed in the Soviet Union.

260.title: MCD polls likely to be delayed; Delhi CM asks, 'Can Centre direct EC?'
260.article_body: Delhi State Election Commissioner SK Srivastava on Wednesday didn't announce dates for MCD polls as EC received a communication from Centre regarding unification of municipal bodies. He said the polls aren't being delayed but EC is seeking legal opinion. Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal questioned whether Centre can direct EC to delay polls. "Why is EC buckling under pressure?" he asked.

261.title: Man accused in POCSO case arrested by Delhi Police after 3 years
261.article_body: A 32-year-old man, accused in a Protection of Children from Sexual Offences (POCSO) Act case, has been arrested by police after absconding for the past three years. The accused, identified as Sandeep Kumar, of Nangloi, was arrested after his location was tracked down by a police team constituted to keep surveillance on proclaimed offenders. He was first arrested in 2013.

262.title: Hyderabad Mayor shares video of her having lunch with women workers
262.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal shared on Twitter a video of her having lunch with women workers of the civic body on the occasion of International Women's Day on Tuesday. "Heartfelt moment to have lunch with the brave women of GHMC...Their contribution in keeping the city clean is commendable," the Mayor wrote on Twitter.

263.title: Pregnant women among 4,000 Better.com workers laid off on Women's Day, says employee
263.article_body: Better.com employee Eric Blattberg shared a colleague's post regarding layoff of roughly 4,000 employees on Tuesday. "Included in...laid-off crowd are pregnant women who trusted Better with their stability," it read. "I wanted to share [the] post calling on Better's leadership...to provide extended medical benefits to currently-pregnant employees they're laying off on...Women's Day," wrote Eric.

264.title: Will stay common man even if I become Punjab CM: AAP's Bhagwant Mann
264.article_body: Ahead of the Punjab Assembly election results, Aam Aadmi Party's (AAP) Punjab CM candidate Bhagwant Mann said on Wednesday that he will remain a common man even if he gets elected as the CM. "I don't think...politics will mess my head if I [win]," Mann added. Exit polls have indicated a victory for Aam Aadmi Party in Punjab.

265.title: Over 400 people detained by Russian National Guard in Kherson: Ukraine
265.article_body: Ukraine's military high command said on Wednesday that members of Russia's National Guard have detained more than 400 people in Ukraine's Kherson oblast. It said that the people had protested against the occupation of their hometowns by Russian forces. "Due to the furious resistance of the residents of Kherson, the occupiers are attempting to introduce an administrative-police regime," it said.

266.title: Mumbai civic body begins dismantling 4 of 9 jumbo COVID-19 centres
266.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has begun the process of dismantling jumbo COVID-19 centres in Mumbai's Goregaon, Dahisar, Kanjurmarg and Mulund. The centres have begun making equipment inventories and physical dismantling of structures will soon follow, said BMC Additional Commissioner Suresh Kakani. Their equipment will be distributed to tertiary and peripheral hospitals, he added.

267.title: Russian soldier given 'wedding suit' to wear after he surrenders uniform in Ukraine
267.article_body: Ukraine Security Service has released a picture of a Russian soldier after capturing him. "The Russian invader was so eager to surrender to the Ukrainians that he surrendered not only his weapons but also his uniform. That is why he is being interrogated by the SBU in a wedding suit given to him out of pity by Ukrainians," it tweeted.

268.title: Arvind Kejriwal will be Prime Minister soon: AAP's Raghav Chadha
268.article_body: AAP MLA Raghav Chadha on Wednesday said Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal "will definitely be seen in [the role of] Prime Minister soon". He added that AAP has emerged as a national political force and that it will be Congress' national and natural replacement. "Not even 10 years since AAP's inception and we're forming government in two states," he added.

269.title: Flight services from Puducherry to B'luru, Hyd to resume from Mar 27
269.article_body: The flight services from Puducherry to Bengaluru and Hyderabad would be resumed from March 27, according to a news report. A press release from the office of the Puducherry Chief Minister N Rangasamy said on Wednesday that booking of tickets to the two cities has begun. Notably, the services were suspended because of the outbreak of COVID-19.

270.title: Must be something special about turning 66: Tharoor as Shah calls to wish him on b'day
270.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Wednesday said Home Minister Amit Shah called him to wish him on his birthday. "Surprised and touched to receive a telephone call from Home Minister [Amit Shah] wishing me on my birthday. There must be something special about turning 66! Most grateful for the kind words," Tharoor tweeted.

271.title: East coast floods to be declared a national emergency in Australia
271.article_body: Australian Prime Minister Scott Morrison on Wednesday said the floods across Australia's east coast that have killed 22 people due to heavy rains will be declared a national emergency. Morrison said the declaration will "ensure all our emergency powers are available and that we cut through any red tape we might face in delivering services and support on the ground".

272.title: Students in Ukraine didn't take advisory seriously: Piyush Goyal
272.article_body: Neither did Indian students in Ukraine take the government's advisory seriously nor did their universities allow them to leave, Union Minister Piyush Goyal said on Wednesday. He claimed 4,000 people returned before the war broke out and more could have come. "Many countries floundered in evacuating citizens from Ukraine. India still evacuated its citizens through neighbouring nations," he added.

273.title: Rahul shares pic of him having ice cream in Wayanad on Instagram
273.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Wednesday took to Instagram to share a picture of him having ice cream in his parliamentary constituency of Wayanad in Kerala. "Many flavours of Wayanad!" Rahul captioned the post. In 2018 also, Rahul was spotted in an ice cream parlour in Madhya Pradesh's Indore along with his party workers.

274.title: SII's Covovax gets emergency use nod by DCGI for adults & for children above age 12
274.article_body: Serum Institute of India's Covovax has been granted Emergency Use Authorisation by DCGI for adults and for children above the age of 12, tweeted CEO Adar Poonawalla on Wednesday. "Younger age groups will follow shortly," he added. Novavax in global trials has demonstrated more than 90% efficacy, Poonawalla's tweet read.

275.title: Kerala Cong chief's life is alms given by our party: CPI(M) leader
275.article_body: CPI(M)'s CV Varghese has triggered a controversy by saying that the life of Kerala Congress chief K Sudhakaran is "alms given by CPI(M)". "We're not interested in killing a wicked person," he said. Later, Varghese claimed Sudhakaran had defended the killers of an SFI worker. "My speech was in tune with the demands of that particular situation," he said.

276.title: Kapil Dev sent a bouquet and a small handwritten note home: Ashwin on breaking his record
276.article_body: Ravichandran Ashwin, who overtook Kapil Dev to become India's second-highest Test wicket-taker, said Kapil sent a bouquet and a small handwritten congratulatory note home. He added, "Sometimes people do forget that people like Kapil Dev, Sachin Tendulkar, Anil Kumble, Harbhajan Singh, those who have done incredible things in the past are one of the reasons why I'm sitting here today."

277.title: Austria suspends its mandatory COVID-19 vaccine law
277.article_body: Austria is suspending its COVID-19 vaccine mandate which took effect as law last month. "We see no need to...implement...[law] due to...[Omicron] variant that we're predominantly experiencing here,” an Austrian minister said. The mandate required those aged 18 and above to provide proof of vaccination to authorities, a failure of which could attract fines up to €3,600 (over ₹3 lakh).

278.title: 36-year-old man runs car over pet dog in Greater Noida; arrested
278.article_body: Police have arrested a 36-year-old man for allegedly mowing down a pet dog with his car in Greater Noida. A police spokesperson said, "The incident [occurred] on February 28 when Zorah, the pet (Siberian husky)...was mowed down with a Toyota Innova Crysta by [the accused]." The pet's owner filed a complaint against the accused man, following which he was arrested.

279.title: SIT formed to probe triple murder case at CNG station in Gurugram
279.article_body: Gurugram's Commissioner of Police Kala Ramachandran formed a five-member Special Investigation Team (SIT) on March 4 to investigate the murder of three employees of a CNG station in Sector 31 on February 28, police said. Police stated that the SIT is headed by Assistant Commissioner of Police (Sadar) Aman Yadav and supervised by Deputy Commissioner of Police (east) Virender Vij.

280.title: Opp'n has accepted defeat that's why they're blaming EVMs: BJP leader
280.article_body: BJP leader Shrikant Sharma on Wednesday said that the Opposition has accepted their defeat in the UP Assembly elections and that's why they're blaming the electronic voting machines (EVMs). He further said that the Samajwadi Party government had only served the interests of particular castes. "People had rejected him (Akhilesh Yadav) in the 2017 elections," Sharma further said.

281.title: Pune district records 235 new COVID cases, 1 death on Tuesday
281.article_body: Maharashtra's Pune district on Tuesday recorded total 235 new COVID-19 cases and one coronavirus-related death. According to the state health department, the total new cases include 72 cases of Pune rural, 133 cases of Pune city and 30 new cases of PCMC. The district, as of Tuesday, reportedly saw the registration of 17.38 million COVID-19 vaccine doses.

282.title: Proposal to rename Delhi's Hauz Qazi Chowk as Hari Chand Verma Chowk withdrawn
282.article_body: AAP councillor Rakesh Kumar's proposal to rename Old Delhi's Hauz Qazi Chowk to Hari Chand Verma Chowk was withdrawn after uproar over social media and opposition by Delhi BJP spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor. Verma was a former Congress leader and councillor. The proposal was given anticipatory approval by North Delhi Municipal Corporation mayor and BJP leader Raja Iqbal Singh.

283.title: Sri Lanka's most sacred elephant Nadungamuwa Raja dies aged 68
283.article_body: Sri Lankan authorities said a state funeral will be held for Nadungamuwa Raja, the country's most sacred elephant, which died aged 68 on Monday near Colombo. Raja was born in India in 1953 and reportedly gifted as one of two calves to a Sri Lankan monk by the King of Mysore. Raja's remains will be stuffed and preserved for posterity.

284.title: 2 Andhra men attempt to sexually assault Lithuanian tourist, arrested
284.article_body: Police have arrested two youth in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore for attempting to sexually assault a 27-year-old Lithuanian tourist. The accused, Sai Kumar, took dollars worth ₹5,000 from the woman and took her to his village promising to return the remaining money. Meanwhile, Kumar called his friend Sheikh Abid, took the tourist to a forest and tried to molest her.

285.title: Delhi experiences clear morning on Wednesday; air quality 'moderate'
285.article_body: Delhi experienced a sunny and clear morning on Wednesday, with the minimum temperature at 14.2 degrees, according to the India Meteorological Department (IMD). The city's air quality fell into the 'moderate' category. The air quality index (AQI) read 149 at 8 am, according to the System of Air Quality and Weather Forecasting And Research (SAFAR).

286.title: GST authorities expand probe into alleged tax evasion by BharatPe
286.article_body: GST authorities have expanded probe into alleged tax evasion by BharatPe to include reported issuance of fake invoices by those close to the firm's ousted Co-founder Ashneer Grover, PTI reported. Bharatpe's books are now being scrutinised to check if bogus invoices were issued for services too. Grover, his wife were stripped of their positions for indulgence in alleged financial irregularities.

287.title: TMC women legislators misbehaved with me in the Assembly: WB Guv
287.article_body: West Bengal Governor Jagdeep Dhankhar on Tuesday wrote to Speaker Biman Banerjee accusing TMC's women legislators of obstructing his movement and misbehaving with him. This comes after the Governor's address was cut short as BJP MLAs created a ruckus over alleged rigging in the civic polls. In the letter, Dhankhar asked Banerjee to meet and fix responsibility for the incident.

288.title: Thought of calling him but couldn't, was shattered after death: Saba on Irrfan
288.article_body: Actress Saba Qamar said she regrets not keeping in touch with her 'Hindi Medium' co-star and late actor Irrfan Khan's family. "When his health deteriorated...I kept thinking I will call him but...I couldn't. One day I heard about him...I was devastated and shattered," she said, adding, "I realised one should avail time they have, because that time never comes back."

289.title: No candidate forced to stay in resort before Goa poll result: Cong
289.article_body: Amid reports of Congress moving its candidates in Goa Assembly polls to a resort before poll results are announced, party leader Sunil Kauthankar said no one has been forced for it. "They voluntarily decided to stay together...Not correct to say that we are keeping a hold on our leaders because leaders have come from other states also," he added.

290.title: B'luru court rejects ED plea for proclamation order against Devas CEO
290.article_body: A special court in Bengaluru has rejected Enforcement Directorate's plea for a proclamation order against Ramachandran Vishwanathan, the CEO of Devas Multimedia. The ED had filed a money laundering case against Ramachandran following a failed 2005 satellite deal between Devas Multimedia and ISRO's commercial arm Antrix Corporation. Notably, a non-bailable warrant was issued against him last month.

291.title: Pic shows Japan's famous 'killing stone' split in half; sparks superstitions online
291.article_body: A picture of ancient rock called Sessho-seki (killing stone) located near the volcanic mountains in Japan's Nasu split into two has gone viral, sparking fear and superstitions on social media. Legend surrounding the stone states that it houses an evil spirit. "After nearly 1,000 years, the demon vixen is presumably once again on the loose," a Twitter user said.

292.title: My computer shut down while I was responding to client: Better.com worker on layoff
292.article_body: A Better.com employee named Amanda Bullard, speaking about the layoff wherein roughly 4,000 workers including her were sacked on Tuesday, shared her experience on LinkedIn. "I didn't find out through...payroll system, my bank account showing a severance check, or a phone call from HR. My computer just shut down in the middle of me responding to [a client]," she stated.

293.title: Canada will send Ukraine another shipment of military equipment: Trudeau
293.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau on Wednesday said that he told Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in a phone call that Canada will "send Ukraine another shipment of highly-specialized military equipment". Both leaders also discussed "sanctions against Russia and humanitarian assistance for Ukraine" during the call. Trudeau said that he has also invited Zelenskyy to address the Canadian Parliament.

294.title: Paytm Payments Bank may ask RBI for SFB licence by June: Report
294.article_body: Paytm Payments Bank is likely to apply to the RBI for a small finance bank (SFB) licence by June, Moneycontrol reported citing sources. "I think (the application for SFB licence will be moved) sometime around May-June next fiscal year," a source was quoted as saying. The bank had received a Scheduled Bank status from RBI last year.

295.title: Pune man cheated of ₹4.9 lakh by fraudster posing as bank employee
295.article_body: A 50-year-old man in Pune was cheated of ₹4.9 lakh by a fraudster posing as an employee of a nationalised bank. The accused allegedly called the victim and asked him to share a one-time password (OTP) on the pretext of helping the latter link his PAN card to his bank account. The man lost the money after sharing the OTP.

296.title: Soldier who had come home on leave goes missing from J&K's Budgam
296.article_body: A soldier of J&K Light Infantry regiment, who had come home on leave, went missing from his village in Kashmir's Budgam district. Police confirmed Sameer Malla has been missing since Monday afternoon when he went out to visit a neighbouring village. "We are looking for him," said Budgam SP, who did not rule out the possibility of Malla being abducted.

297.title: Ex-NSE official Anand Subramanian sent to 14-day judicial custody
297.article_body: Former NSE Group Operating Officer Anand Subramanian has been sent to 14-day judicial custody by a CBI court in connection with the NSE co-location case. Subramanian is the "yogi" who guided the actions of former NSE CEO Chitra Ramakrishna, reports said quoting CBI sources. A Delhi court on Monday also granted seven-day custodial interrogation of Ramakrishna to the CBI.

298.title: Musk posts old meme linking Samsung, Toshiba, Nakamichi & Motorola to Bitcoin creator
298.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk shared an old meme speculating that Satoshi Nakamoto is derived from the names of Samsung, Toshiba, Nakamichi Corp and Motorola. Satoshi Nakamoto is the pseudonym of the developer of Bitcoin whose true identity is unknown. Dogecoin's creator Billy Markus joked, "The creator of Bitcoin is half Japanese, a quarter Korean and a quarter American."

299.title: Maybe after 5-10 yrs people will say we were one of the good teams: Ashwin
299.article_body: India's Ravichandran Ashwin, who recently became India's second-highest wicket-taker in Test cricket, has said he's looking to get better every day and enjoying this phase of his career. "I can see the kind of people I brushed shoulders with...Maybe 5-10 years down the line, people will talk about this being one of the good teams India has produced," he stated.

300.title: I used to bowl medium pace to become the next Kapil Dev: Ashwin
300.article_body: Having surpassed Kapil Dev's tally of 434 wickets in Tests to become India's second-highest wicket-taker in Tests, Ravichandran Ashwin said, "I used to bowl medium pace...so that I can...[become] the next Kapil paaji." "Even in my wildest dreams, I never thought of going past his tally. I always wanted to be a batsman especially when I started off," added Ashwin.

301.title: Centre plans to introduce regional languages in law courses
301.article_body: The Centre is planning to introduce regional languages as the medium of instruction in law courses in colleges across the country. UGC chairperson Jagadesh Kumar said, "Law is one area where our students will benefit if they study in regional languages." "We are discussing this with the vice-chancellors of national universities and other educational institutions," he added.

302.title: Finance Minister Sitharaman interacts with entrepreneurs in Bengaluru
302.article_body: Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on Monday interacted with leading entrepreneurs of IT/BT, Startups and Semiconductor sectors in Bengaluru, a press release said. Expressing her gladness over the Startup ecosystem of Karnataka, she said Karnataka sets an example to be emulated by others. She added, "We should make most of the economic opportunities that exist in the semiconductor sector."

303.title: Liquor sale banned in UP tomorrow in view of counting of votes
303.article_body: The Uttar Pradesh Excise Department said on Wednesday that the sale and operations of liquor will be prohibited in the state tomorrow, March 10, in view of counting of votes. "Action to be taken in case of violation," it added. Separately, UP ADG (Law and Order) Prashant Kumar said 70,000 civil police workers will be deployed tomorrow.

304.title: EC orders action against Varanasi officer over EVMs' transportation
304.article_body: The Election Commission on Wednesday directed UP CEO to take action against Varanasi ADM NK Singh over the alleged violation of rules while transporting EVMs for training purposes. "UP CEO to proceed accordingly," EC said. On Tuesday, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav alleged EVMs were being transported in Varanasi without the knowledge of candidates and claimed SP workers intercepted a truck.

305.title: Akhilesh speaks without logic: UP Minister on SP chief's EVM remark
305.article_body: Reacting to Samajwadi Party (SP) supremo Akhilesh Yadav's allegations of EVM tampering, Uttar Pradesh Minister Mohsin Raza said on Wednesday that Yadav's remarks lack logic. "It is sad to question the working of ECI. Indirectly, they (SP) are accepting their defeat by questioning the EVMs," Raza added. Yadav had alleged on Tuesday that EVMs were being stolen in Varanasi.

306.title: Brazilian club's mascot banned for 1 game for 'intimidatory' gesture
306.article_body: The mascot of Brazilian league champions Atletico Mineiro which is a man-sized chicken has been banned for one game, by the Minas Gerais state football federation due to "intimidatory" behaviour. The mascot ran to prevent one of the Cruzeiro players from celebrating in front of fans, during the derby match last weekend against Atletico Mineiro.

307.title: Bring special law against paper leaks or face mass protest: Hardik Patel
307.article_body: Gujarat Congress working president Hardik Patel on Wednesday demanded a special law against question paper leaks and threatened to launch a mass agitation in Gandhinagar on March 28 if the government doesn't act. "There have been paper leaks in over 20 government recruitment exams in the past few years," he said while asking the youth to join protest in Gandhinagar.

308.title: Thieves break into policeman's house in Maha, steal valuables worth ₹1 lakh
308.article_body: Unidentified men allegedly broke into a policeman's house in Sarda Nagari area of Maharashtra's Beed district and stole valuables worth ₹1.26 lakh, police said on Wednesday. According to police, Assistant Police Inspector (API) Ravindra Shinde's family had travelled to Beed city on March 4. However, on their return the family found that their house had been broken into, police added.

309.title: Size doesn't matter: Mahindra on China's defence budget being 3 times that of India
309.article_body: After China announced its 2022 defence budget of $230 billion, which is three times that of India's, businessman Anand Mahindra said, "Size doesn't matter. The future of warfare will be different." Ukraine's armed drones are playing havoc with convoys of tanks, he tweeted. "It's not how much we spend but how smartly we spend that will matter," Mahindra added.

310.title: Whenever Ranveer meets my parents, he tells them 'I'm proud of her': Deepika
310.article_body: Speaking about her husband-actor Ranveer Singh, actress Deepika Padukone said, "Ranveer is definitely my cheerleader...but it's not just on social media, it's at home, too, like when I try my hand...[in] cooking a meal." She added he's an emotional and sensitive person. "Even when he meets my parents, he always tells them how proud he is of me," she said.

311.title: 62-yr-old watchman beaten to death in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri
311.article_body: A 62-year-old watchman was allegedly beaten to death in the premises of Girja Dayal College in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Tuesday. Police rushed to the college after his body lying in a pool of blood was found inside the premises. "The guard has been murdered by beating, an investigation is being done," police said.

312.title: Israel will pay for Syria attack that killed 2 Revolutionary Guards: Iran
312.article_body: Iran on Wednesday said that Israel "will pay the price" for the Syrian airstrike in which four people, including two Iranian Revolutionary Guards officers, were killed. According to the British-based Syrian Observatory for Human Rights, Monday's attack was the seventh Israeli strike on Syria this year, and the target was a weapon and ammunition depot near Damascus airport.

313.title: Live bat flies inside theatre during 'The Batman' screening in US, video goes viral
313.article_body: A video has gone viral showing a live bat flying inside a theatre in US during a screening of the movie 'The Batman'. Reacting to the video shared by a moviegoer, a user tweeted, "You sure you didn’t pay for the 3D version?" Another user wrote, "The bat deserves to watch the movie too."

314.title: Anmol & I got married in 2014; kept it a secret because of my career: Amrita
314.article_body: Actress Amrita Rao and her husband, radio jockey Anmol revealed in a new video that they tied the knot in a secret wedding in 2014. She said the wedding was kept a secret to make sure the news doesn't hamper her career. Amrita also revealed that they couldn't invite their cousins to the wedding because it was hidden from media.

315.title: People said 'Why would audiences see a pregnant woman in theatres?’: Vidya
315.article_body: Discussing her 2012 film 'Kahaani', actress Vidya Balan said, "[People] were like 'Why would audiences want to see a pregnant woman in theatres?'." "[Director] Sujoy Ghosh came to me with a script I didn't want to do but he [said]...he would keep coming...till I said yes," added Vidya. "I wasn't [willing to do] 'Kahaani'," stated her co-star Nawazuddin Siddiqui.

316.title: CAIT calls CCI 'spineless' for dropping probe against Amazon
316.article_body: CAIT has called the CCI "spineless" and "toothless" for dropping its investigation against Amazon. The investigation was looking into allegations that Amazon copied products of rival manufacturers and used its internal data to boost product lines. CAIT National President BC Bhartia and Secretary General Praveen Khandelwal said it's highly unfortunate CCI has dropped such an investigation.

317.title: Ex-PM Raijv Gandhi’s assassination convict gets bail after 32 years in jail
317.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday granted bail to one of the convicts of former Prime Minister Rajiv Gandhi's assassination. AG Perarivalan, who was sentenced to life imprisonment, has spent 32 years in jail. The court took into account Perarivalan's conduct in jail, his health and that he has spent more than 30 years in prison.

318.title: Pune police adds new member to K9 dog squad, seek a name for it
318.article_body: The Pune Police announced the arrival of a new member to their K9 dog unit's bomb detection squad on Wednesday and sought a name for the dog on Twitter. The new dog is from the Labrador retriever breed. The force has a sanctioned strength of nine dogs, of which four retired after completing their 10 years of service in February.

319.title: Don't remember the last time we saw match like 1st Pak-Aus Test: Inzamam
319.article_body: Criticising the wicket used in the Rawalpindi Test against Australia, ex-Pakistan captain Inzamam-ul-Haq said he doesn't even remember the last time when he saw a match like that. "You make turning pitch, help spinners. You utilize the home advantage, just don't make a dead pitch," he stated. "Even Australia adjusted really well to this pitch," Inzamam further said.

320.title: English batters are not ready to play Test cricket: Matt Prior
320.article_body: Discussing Day 1 of the opening Test between West Indies and England which saw England reduced to 48/4 at one point, ex-England wicketkeeper Matt Prior said the English batters aren't ready to play Tests. "Too many of them have some basic flaws," added Prior. Jonny Bairstow scored an unbeaten 109 to help England finish Day 1 on 268/6.

321.title: Bengal CM Mamata shares stage with Prashant Kishor amid rift rumours
321.article_body: Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee shared stage with poll strategist Prashant Kishor and was seen interacting with him at a TMC meeting in Kolkata on Tuesday amid speculation of a rift. TMC leader Abhishek Banerjee was also present there. "There were certain reports of brewing differences between I-PAC and TMC. But nothing is static in politics," TMC leader Sudip Bandyopadhyay said.

322.title: Odisha college ex-principal held after assets worth more than ₹5 cr found
322.article_body: A former college principal of Biswanathpur's Hira Nila College was arrested in Odisha's Kalahandi district on Tuesday in a disproportionate assets case. This comes after Vigilance Directorate found assets worth more than ₹5 crore in his possession. The officials had conducted searches at five places on Monday. ₹1.94 lakh cash was recovered, among other things, from the accused.

323.title: My ex-boyfriend made me feel like sh*t; I was having sex with a gay man: Saisha
323.article_body: In a recent episode of 'Lock Upp', contestant Saisha Shinde spoke about the time she faced mental abuse in her past relationship. Saisha said, "He made me feel like I'm sh*t. He used to stand outside my door and...wait...that someone will come and I'll cheat." "I was a woman inside who was having sex with a gay man," Saisha added.

324.title: Mumbai Police bid final adieu to bomb squad dog with gun salute
324.article_body: A bomb squad dog named Simba passed away on Friday after serving Mumbai Police for nine years. The canine was given a state funeral at the veterinary hospital in Parel. "A Three Gun Salute For Our Best...You were the best companion and protector we could ever ask for," Mumbai Police tweeted while sharing a video of Simba's funeral.

325.title: Herzog becomes 1st Israeli leader to visit Turkey in 14 years
325.article_body: Israeli President Isaac Herzog is set to visit Turkey on Wednesday, becoming first Israeli leader to visit in 14 years, as both countries seek to normalise relations. Herzog is scheduled to hold talks with his Turkish counterpart Recep Tayyip Erdoğan in capital Ankara and also meet the Jewish community in Istanbul. Both countries had expelled their respective ambassadors in 2018.

326.title: Wrong window: Kajol to fan who asked when she'll work with SRK in Johar's film
326.article_body: Actress Kajol recently conducted an Ask Me Anything session on Instagram on the occasion of Women's Day. During the session, a user questioned Kajol when she would be seen in a Karan Johar movie with actor Shah Rukh Khan. Kajol responded, "That is Karan's pledge to take, wrong window, guys!"

327.title: Akhilesh should be put behind bars for spreading rumours about EVMs: BJP MP
327.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) chief Akhilesh Yadav should be put behind the bars for spreading rumours that the UP government is "stealing" EVMs, BJP Rajya Sabha MP, Harnath Singh Yadav, said. "According to the IPC, spreading rumours, misleading the public and giving wrong information come under the category of serious offences and Akhilesh Yadav is committing such crimes indiscriminately," Harnath added.

328.title: Over 75% youth in 15-18 age group received 1st COVID vaccine dose: Govt
328.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Wednesday said that over 75% of youth between the 15-18 age group have received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine. He said, "Massive participation from Young India has significantly strengthened the world's largest vaccination drive." India has administered 5,55,80,872 first dose of COVID-19 vaccines in this age group as on Wednesday morning, data showed.

329.title: She'll come good soon: Jhulan on Shafali getting out for 2 ducks in last 3 ODIs
329.article_body: India Women pacer Jhulan Goswami has backed 18-year-old batter Shafali Verma, who has registered two ducks in her last three ODI innings, to do well in upcoming matches. "Shafali is batting well in the nets, she is hitting the ball really well. She is just one big knock away…I am sure she is going to do well," added Jhulan.

330.title: Even mild COVID-19 can cause brain to shrink: Oxford University study
330.article_body: COVID-19 can cause the brain to shrink up to 2%, reduce grey matter in regions controlling emotion and memory, and damage areas controlling the sense of smell, an Oxford University study has found. The scientists said the effects were even seen in people who had mild COVID-19. Whether the impact can be partially reversed or not needs more investigation.

331.title: Sanctions on Russia unlikely to affect our defence sector: NITI Aayog member
331.article_body: Sanctions imposed on Russia over its invasion of Ukraine are unlikely to affect India's defence imports, NITI Aayog member VK Saraswat said on Wednesday. He added that Russia possesses inherent military strength and is self-sufficient in military equipment manufacturing. "The reserve is very high. These kinds of short-term sanctions are not likely to create any problems for India," he said.

332.title: Flipping wrong switch caused Taiwan outage, not hackers: Govt report
332.article_body: An operator at the Hsinta coal-fired power plant in Kaohsiung in Taiwan flipped a switch marked 'Do Not Operate' that eventually led to blackouts across multiple regions, including the capital Taipei, a government investigation found. It was earlier speculated that the island's grid had been targeted in a cyberattack.The outage hit around 55 lakh homes.

333.title: Had said no to 'Jalsa', didn't have guts; COVID changed something: Vidya
333.article_body: Actress Vidya Balan who will be seen in 'Jalsa', said she had refused to do the movie and that she did not have "guts to do it". "Then one day when Suresh [Triveni] told me...he reworked script, I said I'd like to hear it again...I read and I was like, 'I am on'," the 'Shaadi Ke Side Effects' actress said.

334.title: Tick saliva drugs can replace painkillers, ease itching in people: Study
334.article_body: Votucalis, a protein found in tick saliva, can be used to make a drug that can replace painkillers and ease itching in people, as per research published in Frontiers in Pharmacology journal. The saliva of brown-ear tick, Rhipicephalus appendiculatus, contains protein that binds with histamine, preventing it from activating cell surface receptors, thereby reducing itching or chronic pain responses.

335.title: SC extends interim relief to ex-Mumbai Police chief Param Bir Singh
335.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday extended the interim protection from the arrest granted to ex-Mumbai Police Commissioner Param Bir Singh in a case related to the allegation of misconduct and corruption. The bench of Justices SK Kaul and MM Sundresh said that the interim order will continue till March 24.

336.title: How are EVMs taken to strong rooms after polling & secured before counting?
336.article_body: After polling at booths, presiding officers prepare an account of votes recorded in the electronic voting machines and give attested copies to each candidate's polling agent. EVMs are then sealed and candidates travel behind vehicles carrying EVMs to strong rooms. The strong rooms are sealed and can't be opened until the morning of counting day, with security forces deployed there.

337.title: Not trying to overthrow Ukraine government: Russia
337.article_body: Amid its invasion of Ukraine, Russia has said that it is not trying to overthrow the country's government. Russia further said that "some progress" is being made in talks with Ukraine. Last month, a senior official of US Department of Defence had said that Russia has "every intention" of overthrowing the Ukrainian government.

338.title: Hardeep Puri inaugurates 3 community centres in Delhi's Rohini
338.article_body: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri on Tuesday inaugurated three air-conditioned community centres in Rohini Sector 7, 8 and 15 in Delhi. "The hard work of BJP MLAs, MPs and Councillors is ushering an era of inclusive development in Delhi," Puri tweeted. "The politics of laying foundation stones...replaced by the policy of completing projects on time and within budgets," he added.

339.title: Fire at B'desh Rohingya camp kills 6-yr-old boy, leaves 2,000 homeless
339.article_body: A six-year-old boy has been killed and about 2,000 people have been left homeless following a fire at a Kutupalong refugee camp in Cox's Bazar, Bangladesh, on Tuesday, authorities said. This is reportedly the sixth fire this year to hit the world's biggest refugee camp. A massive fire in January had destroyed 1,200 shelters and left over 5,000 people homeless.

340.title: UP polls last chance for people to save democracy: Akhilesh Yadav
340.article_body: Ahead of the UP Assembly polls results, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav said that the state elections are the "last chance to save democracy" and after this people will have to "launch a movement" to bring change. He also alleged EVM tampering in the state and said "we may go to court". "We need to save our votes," he added.

341.title: Tiger kills man in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni; body found in pieces
341.article_body: A tiger killed a man who had gone to graze his cattle in a forest in the Seoni district of Madhya Pradesh, a forest official said on Wednesday. Following the incident, the local residents found a few pieces of his body in the forest. Proceedings were being made to provide financial assistance to the deceased's relatives, the forest official added.

342.title: DTC bus depot to be constructed in Savda Ghevra resettlement colony
342.article_body: The Delhi government has decided to construct a DTC bus depot in Savda Ghevra resettlement colony to boost connectivity with central and east Delhi areas. "Once this depot will be ready, 200 buses will start from this resettlement colony," a senior transport official said. The Public Works Department (PWD) has issued tenders for the construction of the depot.

343.title: Webcast vote counting process, share link with parties: SP to EC
343.article_body: Ahead of the counting of votes for recently-concluded UP Assembly polls on Thursday, Samajwadi Party wrote to the Chief Election Commissioner demanding webcasting of the counting process in all constituencies. SP demanded that the link must be shared with all political parties. Earlier, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav had alleged that EVMs were being transported without parties' knowledge in UP.

344.title: 5 minor girls raped & forced into flesh trade in Mumbai, man booked
344.article_body: A 50-year-old man was booked for allegedly raping five minor girls, four of whom are sisters, and forcing them into flesh trade in Mumbai. The incident came to light after a 17-year-old girl, who was rescued from a brothel two years ago, spoke about it. The crime happened from 2018-21 in Chembur. Police said the accused will be arrested soon.

345.title: Ex-Goldman banker faked ex-wife's email account to lie to girlfriend
345.article_body: Former Goldman Sachs banker Tim Leissner has detailed how he used his ex-wife's email to lie to his former girlfriend, Kimora Lee Simmons. Leissner, a key witness against former Goldman banker Roger Ng in the 1MDB scandal, posed as Judy Chan to convince Simmons the two were no longer married. Leissner was questioned about the phoney account by Ng's lawyer.

346.title: Latest rankings for Test batters out, Virat Kohli overtakes Rohit Sharma
346.article_body: The ICC today announced the latest rankings for Test batters, with former India captain Virat Kohli overtaking India captain Rohit Sharma. Virat Kohli jumped two spots to be ranked fifth, while Rohit Sharma dropped a place to be ranked sixth. Rishabh Pant moved into the top 10 after jumping one spot.

347.title: Don't rush: TMC to Meghalaya CM Sangma on border pact with Assam
347.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) asked Meghalaya CM Conrad Sangma not to rush into a border pact with Assam. "I'd like to appeal to the government to hold on, have a more exhaustive understanding about this...issue," TMC's Mukul Sangma said. This comes after Conrad Sangma said that 30 of the 36 disputed villages along the Meghalaya-Assam border will remain in Meghalaya.

348.title: Sensex ends 1,223 points higher at 54,647 ahead of assembly poll results
348.article_body: The Sensex ended 1,223 points or over 2% higher at 54,647 on Wednesday, a day ahead of five state assembly election results. The broader Nifty 50 also jumped 332 points or 2% to close at 16,345. The benchmark indices ended in the green for the second straight day. Reliance Industries, Asian Paints, Bajaj Finance were among top Sensex gainers.

349.title: 'Is she man or woman': Kerala tribal activist alleges verbal abuse on train
349.article_body: Malayali tribal activist Dayabai has alleged that she faced verbal abuse by her co-passengers on a train from Ernakulam to Rajkot.
