Dayabai reportedly heard a co-passenger, talking on the phone, say, "Look at her face, is she a man or a woman?" When she complained about too much noise in the train, the co-passengers said she should have taken flight.

350.title: India is one of those countries which will decide fate of this century: Ukrainian MP
350.article_body: Ukraine's youngest MP Sviatoslav Yurash said India is one of those countries which will decide fate of this century. "As far as Indian position on Russian relationship is concerned, we're thankful for the call PM Modi made to our President. We're thankful for humanitarian steps India...has been making," he added. Sviatoslav further said "Russia needs to be punished by India".

351.title: Karnataka's Shobha Gasti, Nivruti Rai honoured by President Kovind
351.article_body: On International Women's Day, President Ram Nath Kovind presented Nari Shakti Puraskar to Shobha Gasti and Nivruti Rai from Karnataka along with 29 other women for their contribution in various fields. While Gasti was honoured for her work towards women and girls' empowerment, Nivruti Rai, Country Head, Intel India, was honoured for her outstanding contribution in the field of technology.

352.title: Hyd may see traffic curbs during Assembly session from March 9-15
352.article_body: The Hyderabad Traffic Police has issued an advisory in view of the ongoing Telangana Legislative Assembly session. The police said that traffic may be stopped or diverted from March 9 to March 15 in some routes. The areas where traffic congestion is likely include Telugu Thalli – Iqbal Minar – Ravindra Bharathi route.

353.title: 1 killed, 13 injured in explosion in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur
353.article_body: At least one person was killed and 13 others were injured following an explosion near the Tehsildar office in Jammu and Kashmir's Udhampur on Wednesday. "Exact cause...of the blast being worked out...too early to draw any definite conclusion," BJP leader Dr Jitendra Singh said. "Injured being moved to hospital. I'm in touch with DC Smt Indu Chib," he tweeted.

354.title: Noida woman jumps to death from 26th floor as she failed to clear UPSC
354.article_body: A 31-year-old woman allegedly died by suicide after jumping from the 26th floor of a building in Noida. Police said the woman, who'd previously worked at State Bank of India, had quit her job to prepare for the UPSC exam. However, she reportedly failed to clear it and became depressed, police added. Her mother was at home when this happened.

355.title: Land unavailable for making parking space for vehicles: Pune Metro
355.article_body: After commuters complained of parking issues near the newly operational Pune Metro, MahaMetro, which is implementing the project, said that land for making parking space for vehicles is not available. "There is a paucity of land along the Pune-Mumbai highway for developing parking space," its spokesperson said. He added, "If we get the land, we will set up parking lots."

356.title: Cabinet approves SPV for sale of surplus govt land and buildings
356.article_body: The Union Cabinet has approved setting up of the National Land Monetisation Corporation (NLMC), a special purpose vehicle (SPV) to handle the sale of surplus government land and buildings. NLMC's board will include senior central government officers and eminent experts. In addition to selling surplus land and buildings, NLMC will own and manage surplus assets of central PSUs under closure.

357.title: Musk seeks to end SEC deal requiring his tweets to be pre-approved
357.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has asked a federal judge to terminate his 2018 agreement with the US SEC requiring some of his tweets to be vetted by a lawyer. "The SEC's pursuit...has crossed the line into harassment, which is quintessential bad faith," lawyers said. The decree was signed in 2018 after Musk's "funding secured" tweet on taking Tesla private.

358.title: Mumbai Police detains Fadnavis over protest demanding Nawab's resignation
358.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM and senior BJP leader Devendra Fadnavis was detained by Mumbai Police for allegedly participating in a protest demanding NCP leader and Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik's resignation. Malik was arrested by ED over an alleged money laundering case linked to underworld don Dawood Ibrahim. Fadnavis was seen clenching his fist while he was being taken away by police.

359.title: Ravindra Jadeja becomes world number one all-rounder in Test cricket
359.article_body: Team India all-rounder Ravindra Jadeja has become the world number one all-rounder in Test cricket after jumping two spots in the latest ICC rankings. This comes after Jadeja scored 175*(228) and took nine wickets in the first Test against Sri Lanka. Jadeja is on top with 406 rating points. Ravichandran Ashwin is ranked third.

360.title: Ukraine's air defences having success against Russian jets: UK
360.article_body: UK's Defence Ministry on Wednesday said Ukraine's air defences have "enjoyed considerable success against Russia's modern combat aircraft". This has likely prevented Moscow from achieving "any degree of control of the air", it added. According to UK's Defence Intelligence report, fighting in Kyiv's northwest region is ongoing but Russian forces have failed to make "any significant breakthroughs".

361.title: SAT declines to stay SEBI order directing Dish TV to disclose AGM results
361.article_body: Securities Appellate Tribunal (SAT) has declined to stay SEBI's order directing Dish TV to disclose voting results of its annual general meeting (AGM). SAT has also directed Dish TV to file its reply in the matter against SEBI's order by March 20.  SEBI passed the order after receiving complaints from Yes Bank and other Dish TV shareholders.

362.title: Small Ukrainian boy cries as he walks to Poland border; video surfaces
362.article_body: A video of a small Ukrainian boy crying while walking to Poland border amid war is being widely shared online. The video shows the boy dragging his belongings in a bag while crying loudly. While the child appears to be alone in the video, reports claimed he was walking behind his mother.

363.title: Partnership in middle crucial: Bairstow on ton after Eng were 48/4 vs WI
363.article_body: England batter Jonny Bairstow, who is currently unbeaten at 109, has said partnerships through the middle of their innings on Day 1 in the ongoing Test against West Indies were crucial. England were 48/4 when Bairstow came in to bat and added 67 runs with Ben Stokes for the fifth wicket. He then added 99 runs with Ben Foakes.

364.title: PMC to start classes for 1st batch of MBBS at new medical college
364.article_body: After receiving approval from National Medical Commission(NMC), Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is set to start classes for first batch of 100 MBBS students at its new medical college. The Bharat Ratna Atal Bihari Vajpayee Medical College will commence classes from December this year, PMC Mayor Murlidhar Mohol said. The college will be under Maharashtra University of Health Sciences, Nashik.

365.title: I wanted to spend money on my body after being skin-shamed: Tejasswi
365.article_body: Speaking about dealing with body-shaming, actress Tejasswi Prakash said she used to feel bad at that time. She added, "I was...receiving negative comments because I was underweight." Tejasswi added she wanted to spend money on her body after she was called out for being skinny. "It was...tempting but then I told myself...if I...change myself, I'm no different," she added.

366.title: 35 MP natives stuck at Ukraine's Sumy likely to return tonight: State govt
366.article_body: Nearly 35 natives of Madhya Pradesh stuck in Ukraine's Sumy city have left the country and are likely to reach India by tonight, state Home Minister Narottam Mishra said on Wednesday. "All are safe...and...in touch with their family members," Mishra added. The MP government had announced that it will arrange for stay, food and transportation of students returning from Ukraine.

367.title: China to send humanitarian aid worth 5 million yuan to Ukraine
367.article_body: The Chinese Red Cross will send humanitarian assistance worth 5 million yuan (over ₹6 crore) to Ukraine, said the Chinese foreign ministry on Wednesday. The announcement comes amid the ongoing conflict between Russia and Ukraine, which has resulted in lakhs of Ukrainians fleeing the country. The country is also facing shortage of food, water and electricity.

368.title: Father, his sons arrested for kidnapping student, demanding ₹7 lakh in B'luru
368.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested a father, his sons for allegedly abducting a 21-year-old student from his residence and demanding a ransom of ₹7 lakh. The kidnappers earlier used to be neighbours of the student and were aware that his mother had received a share of his father's ancestral property after his death, which was sold last year, the police said.

369.title: Pune govt hospital superintendent demands bribe from pvt doctor, held
369.article_body: The medical superintendent of a sub-district hospital in Bhor taluka in Pune district has been booked for allegedly demanding a bribe of ₹10,000 from a private doctor. The 60-year-old accused had demanded the bribe for not giving a negative report about the sonography centre in the hospital run by the doctor. The accused was nabbed while accepting ₹5,000 on Tuesday.

370.title: US man caught smuggling 52 lizards, snakes in packets hidden in his clothes
370.article_body: A 30-year-old man from the US was caught trying to smuggle as many as 52 reptiles including 43 horned lizards and nine snakes at a border crossing with Mexico. According to customs officials, the man, who was driving a truck, kept the reptiles tied up in small bags which were hidden in his jacket, pants pockets and groin area.

371.title: Mumbai court sentences man to 5-yr-jail for daughter-in-law's suicide
371.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced an 82-year-old man to five years of rigorous imprisonment for allegedly abetting the suicide of his daughter-in-law 11 years ago. The court noted that he repeatedly abused her in a drunken state and threatened to kill her. "It is not expected by any daughter-in-law that she would be given such inhuman treatment," it added.

372.title: Australian Army Chief pays respects at National War Memorial in Delhi
372.article_body: Chief of Australian Army, Lieutenant General Rick Burr, paid his respects to the martyred Indian soldiers and laid a wreath at the National War Memorial in Delhi on Wednesday. Burr, who is on a two-day visit to India, was received by the Army Chief General Manoj Mukund Naravane. He was also given a Guard of Honour at the South Block.

373.title: Pics of crowds at Soviet Union's 1st McDonald's surface as firm shuts Russian shops
373.article_body: Pictures showing long queues outside Soviet Union's first McDonald's on its opening day surfaced online after the company temporarily shut restaurants in Russia. The first McDonald's opened in Moscow's Pushkin Square in 1990, symbolising the opening of USSR to the West. "I stood in line for...an hour to get a cheeseburger in 1990...It's a sad day," a Twitter user said.

374.title: ICC announces Player of the Month nominations for February, 3 Indians included
374.article_body: ICC has announced Player of the Month nominations for February, with three Indians included across the two categories. Shreyas Iyer, who won Player of the Series award for scoring three unbeaten fifties against Sri Lanka in T20Is, has been nominated in men's category, while Mithali Raj and Deepti Sharma have been nominated for ICC Women's Player of the Month award.

375.title: National agencies get trained by BJP, fabricate cases: Raut
375.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said national agencies like NCB, CBI and ED get trained by BJP and fabricate cases, not Maharashtra Police. "False cases are never filed against anybody in Maharashtra," he added. Referring to Ex-Maharashtra CM Devendra Fadnavis' claims that Maharashtra government is working to frame BJP leaders, Raut said, "His sensational remarks are maligning state police."

376.title: Global carbon dioxide emissions reach highest level in history: Experts
376.article_body: The global emission of carbon dioxide (CO2) has reached its highest levels in history, experts said. CO2 emissions rose by 6% in 2021 to 36.3 billion metric tons, a report stated. During pandemic, carbon emission declined due to lesser consumption of fossil fuels but as the world economy rebounded post-COVID with heavy reliance on fossil fuels, CO2 emissions surged massively.

377.title: Russia claims Ukraine was planning to attack Donbass in March, shares 'secret' document
377.article_body: Russian foreign ministry shared a 'secret' document it allegedly acquired during special military operation in Ukraine. "Classified documents (order by Commander National Guard of Ukraine) confirm...Kiev regime was covertly preparing an offensive operation against Donbass [in] March 2022," it wrote. Ukrainian government forces and pro-Russian separatists have been fighting in Donbass since 2014.

378.title: Why did US reject Poland's offer to provide its MiG-29 jets to Ukraine?
378.article_body: The US rejected Poland's offer to transfer its MiG-29 jets to a base in Germany to be provided to Ukraine in the war against Russia. The Pentagon said the prospect of flying combat aircraft from NATO territory into the war zone "raises serious concerns for the entire NATO alliance". NATO has said it does not want direct conflict with Russia.

379.title: More military at India & China borders increases risk of armed confrontation: US
379.article_body: The annual threat assessment of the US Intelligence Community stated that expanded military posture by both India and China along the disputed border elevates the risk of armed confrontation between two nuclear powers. It added that this "might involve direct threats to US persons and interests and calls for US intervention." It also said that Indo-China relations will remain strained.

380.title: Next generation bowlers can forget about 1000 int'l wickets: Ashwin on Warne
380.article_body: India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin has said that the next generation of bowlers can forget about getting 1000+ international wickets, a record held by Shane Warne, who passed away last week, and Muttiah Muralitharan. "[Because] the volume of Test cricket will come down drastically. And also because there are so many leagues, workload management will take centre-stage," Ashwin explained.

381.title: Girl who sells balloons in Kerala turns model, makeover pics go viral
381.article_body: A balloon seller from Kerala has gone viral after photos of her makeover were posted online. The girl named Kisbu was selling balloons near a temple when she was spotted by photographer Arjun Krishnan, who took a few pictures of the teenager, one of which he posted on Instagram. It went viral and led to Kisbu starring in a photoshoot.

382.title: No 4th COVID wave in India unless a differently-behaving variant comes up: Virologist
382.article_body: Virologist Dr T Jacob John has said he is "fairly confident" that no fourth COVID-19 wave will occur in India unless an unexpected variant that behaves differently comes up. John, the former director of Indian Council for Medical Research's Centre of Advanced Research in Virology, said it can be confidently concluded that the third COVID-19 wave has ended.

383.title: Bumble removes all its dating apps from Russia & Belarus
383.article_body: Bumble is discontinuing its operations in Russia and removing all of its dating apps from Apple App Store and Google Play Store in Russia and Belarus. Bumble expects losing about $20 million in revenue in 2022 from this move. The combined revenue from Russia, Ukraine and Belarus was approximately 2.8% of its total revenue in 2021, mostly from Badoo app.

384.title: Bengaluru police shoot 2 murder accused in leg after they attack police
384.article_body: Bengaluru police on Wednesday allegedly opened fire to arrest two people wanted in a murder case. Reportedly, the men were on a two-wheeler and upon being confronted by the police, they attacked the policemen. Police, in order to defend themselves and arrest the culprits, then fired rounds at their legs to immobilise them, Times Now reported.

385.title: Pune court denies bail to medical student in ₹10-lakh extortion case
385.article_body: A Pune court on Monday denied bail to a medical student who was arrested for allegedly extorting ₹10 lakh from an engineering student. The accused, Amar Suryakant Poul, had allegedly sought money on pretext of establishing a media office and threatened to kill the victim if he didn't comply. Notably, Poul also has other cases of cheating registered against him.

386.title: Russia, Ukraine agree on day-long evacuation corridors
386.article_body: A Ukrainian official has said that Russia and Ukraine have agreed on day-long evacuation corridors to help civilians escape the war. Thousands are thought to have died or been wounded amid the biggest attack on a European state since World War II. Earlier, at least 10 people were killed in a Russian military attack in Severodonestk.

387.title: Poland offers to place its MiG-29 jets at US disposal to be provided to Ukraine
387.article_body: Poland has said that it is ready to deploy its MiG-29 jets to Ramstein Air Base in Germany and put them at US disposal for them to be provided to Ukraine. "Poland requests the US to provide us with used aircraft with corresponding operational capabilities. Poland is ready to immediately establish the conditions of purchase of the planes," it said.

388.title: Raising questions on EVM is anti-democratic: BJP to Akhilesh Yadav
388.article_body: Reacting to Akhilesh Yadav's claims of EVM tampering, the BJP said that raising questions on EVM is anti-democratic. "Akhilesh Yadav ji raising questions on EVMs is not only ridiculous but also anti-democratic. Did BJP question EVMs after defeat in Chhattisgarh, Rajasthan etc.?," BJP's Arvind Menon said. "Poor EVMs, they have to bear the brunt of Dynasts," BJP's CT Ravi said.

389.title: IPO-bound Mobikwik posts 1st-ever profit of ₹7 cr in Dec quarter
389.article_body: IPO-bound fintech firm Mobikwik recorded its first-ever profit of ₹7 crore in the December 2021 quarter after losing money in the first and second quarters. The company had achieved revenue of around ₹400 crore in the nine-month period ended December 31, an 86% growth on a year-on-year basis. It expects its full financial year of 2022-23 to be profitable.

390.title: I didn't know much English: Sushmita recalls answering Miss Universe question
390.article_body: Sushmita Sen recalled the question that led to her winning the 1994 Miss Universe pageant. Sushmita was asked, "What for you is the essence of being a woman?" In a recent interview, Sushmita revealed she was from Hindi medium school and didn't know much English at that time. "I don't know how...I answered that question with such clarity," she added.

391.title: Saw them painting faces, they broke with pain in time: Bhansali on sex workers
391.article_body: Filmmaker Sanjay Leela Bhansali, while speaking to actress Alia Bhatt in an interview recalled how he saw sex workers during his childhood. "I saw them painting their faces and I saw their faces broken in time with pain. They were trying to look beautiful but looked uglier and uglier because it was distortion," Bhansali said.

392.title: Telangana govt to fill up 91,142 direct recruitment vacancies: CM KCR
392.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Wednesday announced the state government's decision to fill up 91,142 direct recruitment vacancies in the state. "The services of 11,103 contract employees working against direct recruitment vacancies will be regularised," he said. "The recruitment process for the remaining vacancies of 80,039 would be taken up immediately," Rao further said.

393.title: UP policeman congratulates BJP leader before poll results, probe ordered
393.article_body: A probe has been ordered against a policeman in Uttar Pradesh after he was seen congratulating BJP state vice-president Dayashankar Singh on becoming a cabinet minister ahead of the poll results in a video. A transfer order has also been issued for the policeman. The counting of votes of the 2022 UP Assembly elections is scheduled for March 10.

394.title: Sehwag congratulates Ashwin over 'mankading' rule change, says 'Ek karna zaroor'
394.article_body: Ex-cricketer Virender Sehwag took to Twitter to congratulate Ravichandran Ashwin after MCC removed 'mankading' from 'Unfair play' to 'Run-out' section in its laws. "Congratulations Ashwin, great week this one. First becoming second-highest [Test] wicket-taker for India...and now this. Ab full freedom to plot such run-outs with Buttler. Ek karna zaroor." Ashwin had 'mankaded' Buttler in IPL 2019.

395.title: No-confidence motion submitted against Pakistan PM to remove him from office
395.article_body: Pakistan's Opposition parties have submitted a no-confidence motion against PM Imran Khan to remove him from office after holding his government responsible for the uncontrolled inflation. The motion was signed by about 100 lawmakers. Last year, Khan got 178 votes when he had decided to seek a vote of confidence after a candidate supported by his party lost Senate election.

396.title: I put on a lot of weight; was shocked to see those pics myself: Fardeen
396.article_body: Actor Fardeen Khan said people were shocked to see his pictures after he put on weight. "It wasn't that I was living in denial...I was...shocked when I saw those pictures myself," he added. "You can either let it work for you or let it destroy you. I'm not one of those who sits and wallows in self-pity," Fardeen said.

397.title: Millions of children trembling at every sound: Ukrainian model Veronika
397.article_body: Talking about the Russian invasion of Ukraine, Ukrainian model Veronika Didusenko said, "Millions of Ukrainian children..., their mothers are trembling at every sound...and...more heartbreaking are those forced to give birth." "Directly above my head, dozens of...helicopters...were bombing an...airfield," added Veronika. "Cities...are on the verge of a humanitarian catastrophe," stated the model.

398.title: 3 killed after being trapped in coal mine in Telangana’s Peddapalli
398.article_body: Three people were found dead after being trapped following an accident in Singareni Collieries in Telangana's Peddapalli district, the officials said on Wednesday. The incident occurred on Monday afternoon when a portion of the roof or the side wall of the mine collapsed. Among the dead, two were company officials while one was an outsourced worker.

399.title: Mumbai woman loses ₹20,000 while trying to order wine online
399.article_body: A 24-year-old Mumbai-based woman was duped of ₹20,406 by a cyber fraudster in a wine shop-cum-Google listing fraud. According to the complainant's statement, she had ordered wine from the 'Wine and Wine' shop after looking up their number on Google. A man received the call and sent her QR codes to make the payment after which the amount was deducted.

400.title: Chhattisgarh’s GSDP estimated to grow by 11.5%, says economic survey
400.article_body: Chhattisgarh's Gross State Domestic Product (GSDP) is estimated to grow by 11.54% and the per capita income by 11.93% in the financial year 2021-22, according to the economic survey presented by the state government in the Legislative Assembly on Tuesday. The survey report was presented by Planning, Economics and Statistics Minister Amarjeet Bhagat.

401.title: What are the major announcements made in Chhattisgarh Budget 2022-23?
401.article_body: In his Budget 2022-23 speech, Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Wednesday announced that the old pension scheme will be restored. "₹2 crore proposed for Chhattisgarh Rojgar Mission to work on the possibilities of creating new jobs," Baghel added. Chhattisgarh government has increased the annual assistance under Rajiv Gandhi Bhumihin Krishi Majdur Nyay Yojana from ₹6,000 to ₹7,000 from next year.

402.title: Antarctic explorer's ship found 107 years after it sank
402.article_body: The wreck of Endurance, the lost ship of Antarctic explorer Sir Ernest Shackleton, was found at the weekend at the bottom of the Weddell Sea. The ship was crushed by sea-ice and sank in 1915, forcing Shackleton and his men to escape on foot and in small boats. Its name - Endurance - is clearly visible on the stern.

403.title: CM Baghel brings briefcase made of cow dung to present Chhattisgarh Budget, shares pic
403.article_body: Chattisgarh Chief Minister Bhupesh Baghel walked in the Chhattisgarh Assembly carrying a briefcase made of cow dung ahead of the state Budget. The briefcase had "Gomaye Vasate Lakshmi" written on it in Sanskrit, which translates to "Goddess of wealth Laxmi resides in cow dung". Chhattisgarh government had announced in 2020 that it'll procure cow dung from cow breeders and farmers.

404.title: IndiGo, SpiceJet shares jump as ban on international flights lifted after 2 years
404.article_body: Shares of Indian airlines, including SpiceJet, IndiGo parent InterGlobe Aviation and Jet Airways, rose 5-8% each, a day after the government lifted the ban on regular international flights after two years. The Centre will resume scheduled commercial international passenger flights to and from India from March 27. Currently, international flights operate under air bubble arrangements with nations.

405.title: Security measures in place at EVM strong room: Lucknow Police Commissioner
405.article_body: There are adequate security measures in place at EVM strong room, DK Thakur, Police Commissioner, Lucknow, said on Wednesday. "Strong room will be opened at around 7 am in the presence of election observers and candidates. Counting (of votes) will begin at 8 am tomorrow. Police patrolling will be done in sensitive areas," Thakur added.

406.title: Better.com accidentally sent severance cheques a day before mass layoffs: Report
406.article_body: US-based mortgage lending startup Better.com accidentally released severance payslips a day before mass layoffs were meant to be announced, TechCrunch reported citing employees. "No email, no call, nothing. This was handled disgustingly," an employee, who received a severance cheque, said. After the mistake, CFO Kevin Ryan sent an email to employees confirming the layoffs in US and India.
